website_summaries.verdict: A reliable, sturdy pick with a large capacity that works best for cooking for groups.
pros: Combination of porcelain and cast iron constructions retains heat and keeps food hot for hours
cons: Heavy and smaller handles can make handling difficult
Some say the enamel chips too easily

customer_reviews.title: Enamel on the cooking surface chipped after minimal use.
customer_reviews.text: After 5 uses, using only wooden utensils, microfiber cleaning cloths, and NO oven use the enamel inside on the bottom (read: cooking surface) chipped in the center. The attached pic shows the chip that we found while in the middle of cooking dinner. Extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: CM Burr

customer_reviews.title: Bum recommendation from ATK
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed with this pot, especially after America's Test Kitchen's recommendation of it as a "best buy." After three uses, big chunks of the outside enamel started falling off and those spots are now rusted. Cuisinart's lifetime guarantee is worthless since it costs as much if not more for shipping and handling for a return than the pot is worth. I knew I should have stuck with Le Creuset! A lot more expensive but definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gog

customer_reviews.title: Another Chipped Lid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Amazon over a year ago. Shortly after it arrived, the lid handle came loose and I wasn’t able to tighten it because the screw threads were stripped. The paint around the handle then started to chip and it just keeps getting worse. Will be contacting Cuisinart customer service tomorrow for warranty information but given other reviews here, I’m not very hopeful that I will get good results. Plus, their warranty advises that the customer must pay shipping charges to and from Cuisinart, which I find ridiculous as this item is very heavy. You are better off saving your money and buying a le crueset...Far superior in every way to this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Donna W

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke while taking it out of the oven
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of use the handle of our skillet broke and almost took out my wife's foot. As she was taking the pan out of the oven with one piece of sea bass in it, the handle snapped and the skillet fell to the floor narrowly missing my wife's foot. Not only is this product defective it's dangerous and shouldn't be on the market. Amazon needs to pull this its website and stop selling it before someone gets hurt. It's unconscionable to think that they would allow a product like this to be sold. DO NOT BUY!!!!!! This skillet is DANGEROUS!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Man

customer_reviews.title: Chipped before using
customer_reviews.text: The one star is for the appearance. I just bought this item and was looking forward to using it. Just as I was about to make a soup, I noticed that that the inside was flaking and the enamel fell off when I touched it. I also found a chip on the edge of the lid. This item has not been used yet and has been sitting on our counter top for a few days. Sadly I am returning it and will look for another brand. I want something that is going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Carol van Heerden

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Large pieces of the enamel coating chipped off within two uses. Definitely avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Bad paint popping off
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Used 3 times and enamel paint is popping off in the ice. Need to replace this but no place to do that...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this use for most everything  EXCEPT .. PLEASE NOTE IMPORTANT for you to know
customer_reviews.text: I had it for 5 weeks made a Morrocan Chicken casserole loaded with onions, celery rice 3 lbs chicken spices... forgot how heavy it is... even empty... and worse me disabled vet loss the use of my left thumb.. and oh well... dropped it taking out of the oven... Sadly hit the floor on its side... cracked the pot from the top to almost the bottom and worse some of the enamel peeled off inside and out... hd to buy a new one.. no replecement ofered :(
customer_reviews.author: J. P. S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value Compared to Le Creuset
customer_reviews.text: I was a tried and true fan of Le Creuset products, but after reading a review about this line of Cuisinart enameled pots, I thought I'd try one out. I was astounded by the excellent quality for the price compared to the Le Creuset products I'm used to. Clean up after several uses is still easy and all the browned bits from cooking easily come off the porcelain and it still looks brand new. Glad I tried this out. I will be adding more sizes to my collection soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T

customer_reviews.title: Basic Cast Iron Pan
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pan because I absolutely love my enameled dutch oven and wanted to find a pan with a similar coating. After reading about this product I inferred that the inside of this pan was enameled to avoid sticking that often goes hand-in-hand with cast iron pans. Unfortunately the pan is only enameled on the outside - the inside of the pan, while well seasoned, is not enameled. The pan works fine as a standard cast-iron pan, but be forewarned that it is not fully enameled.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made Dutch oven
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of Americas Test Kitchen show. They're equipment review segment stated this was the best product at a reasonable price and they are correct! It's well made and food cooks beautifully in it.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Followed all directions for cooking and cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Followed all directions for cooking and cleaning. I used wooden utensils while cooking and after cooking, I cleaned it with warm soapy water and a sponge. When it dried, the interior was splotchy black and grey. Bare metal was showing. So sending it back tomorrow
customer_reviews.author: StoryKeeper

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great deal on what are normally very expensive dutch ovens. I have no idea why Le Cruset are so astronomically expensive and then the cheap ones break or can't tolerate higher temperatures. I used this for the first time last night and it held up well under 500 degree temps. Good size, seems to be well made. If the ceramic starts to flake like it does on cheap ones I will update the ad!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite cooking is braising and making soups to freeze. And eating. I like eating. But, I'm only one person! And sometimes I want just a single portion of braised short ribs, or something small that's trying to be a pot roast. This pot is so great! Takes up very little space, and of course the cast iron construction is so lovely for gentle heat retention through hours of slow cooking. I'm already using it - delighted with the very even quality of the porcelain application, the smooth texture of the iron underlying it. This is a quality pot, for about half the cost of those European brands.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Food comes out great and it cleans up well
customer_reviews.text: Works well, weighs a ton (16-1/2 lbs, empty, with lid, if my bathroom scale is to be believed) and causes my oven rack to sag. I put a sheet pan under it to spread the load - don't want to find out what would happen if a full pot caused a rack to fail in a hot oven. Food comes out great and it cleans up well. It's probably bigger than I need it to be (11-1/4" inner diam x 4-1/2" high). Glad I have it, though.
customer_reviews.author: A-fan

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice Dutch Oven but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: I've used this dutch oven primarily for dishes that have to be started on the stove and finished in the oven. It works well, it heats fairly evenly, it's relatively easy to clean even when there is baked-on food. The only real drawback is that it is really heavy, around 16#. That's a lot of weight for some of my household to hold up at arm's length as in reaching into the oven. The handles are a bit small and they definitely retain heat.
customer_reviews.author: William Renfroe

customer_reviews.title: Warning...very heavy
customer_reviews.text: I have been anxious to get a dutch oven and bought this one, recommended by professional cooks as a good alternative to the more expensive dutch ovens. At $69 it is a bargain. What I did not realize was how heavy it is. It was so heavy I could not lift it when it was delivered on my porch. Admittedly I did not check on the weight before I ordered it.....but later I find item weight is listed as 1 pound.....no way..closer to the 18 lbs listed as the shipping weight. I am writing this evaluation simply to make people aware of the weight before they order. One star because for me it is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: KColt

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Dutch oven after reading America’s Test Kitchen reviews and couldn’t be happier. They reviewed several Dutch ovens with number one being the very expensive Le Creuset at over $300.00 and Cuisinart being number two. They were spot on. It’s heavy but I like the heat distribution and size. It’s just me and my spouse and we have plenty of leftovers for a second or sometimes third meal or lunch. I bought this after the holidays and have already made four recipes with all of them turning out fantastic. This is really easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: happy hiker

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Within a few weeks of use it peeled, flaked and changed color. do not buy
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT MENDELSOHN

customer_reviews.title: The size is perfect, but the quality is not
customer_reviews.text: PLease do not bother buying this product! The size is perfect, but the quality is not. The color coating must just be a lacquer and not baked on. It flakes and chips off! Buy the more expensive Le Crueset brand. I’m going to... I learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: adebuyser

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy red 5 qt version of this product
customer_reviews.text: These 5-quart Dutch Oven pots in RED seem to be consistently poor quality. I’ve returned two. Both pots did not have a lid that seals. They were uneven fits that let steam moisture go right to the stove top. One of the two had a warped bottom = not safe. NOTE: I bought this same pot in blue in 7 qt. It was perfect. Too heavy for me,, however, so I returned it. That’s where I got my experience with the red 5 qt dogs. I bought a 5 qt in blue, and, it’s perfect. Coincidence? All I can tell you is the truth, this is what happened. Red, bad. Blue good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Never mess with your old cast iron skillet again.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this (10") Cuisinart enameled cast iron skillet. Does not feel as heavy and unwieldy as my old cast iron skillets. Cleans like a dream. Can soak it in water with no ill effects. Doesn't move or wobble on burner ( I have induction.) And it's pretty. It's such a delight to use that it's become a regular go-to skillet instead of the occasional- oh dear, I must use my cast iron. True test was pineapple upside down cake. Stovetop to Oven - easy to turn out onto plate. Nothing was left in skillet. This price is too good to pass up. Buy it. Use it. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: portia

customer_reviews.title: The perfect poor man's Le Creuset
customer_reviews.text: My favorite pan! It has held up great, even through being treated a bit rough and sitting in the sink with water in it for too long. Enamel has held up inside and out. It's my poor man's Le Creuset all the way.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Knock-off product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 'enameled cast iron' product last week with the intention to use it in the oven. I did so twice and the third time it cracked in two pieces. Turned out it is not just a porcelain enamel, but a porcelain pot - not cast iron as it is sold as. I assume that this is either a mistake OR a knock-off product. Either way, it is more luck than anything that it cracked while in the oven and not on the stove full of liquids.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Christensen

customer_reviews.title: These pots are heavy and you need to read instructions how to clean
customer_reviews.text: They work great and do a great slow cook! They are so heavy, we remove them from the oven and put them on top of an unlit burner on the nearby stove. Then, we let people ladle out what they want to eat and take their bowls to the table.ng This avoids burning/scorching the table top or worse, family members if the pot gets overturned.
customer_reviews.author: Grampa

customer_reviews.title: Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: I love this dutch oven! I saw the reviews for it on America's Test Kitchen and it is a keeper. I like the red color and it is a breeze to clean. I use Bar Keepers Friend Soft Polish, I won't put it in the dishwasher. The only drawback is that it is quite heavy, but I can live with that. It works well on my glass stove top and I am careful not to slide it.This dutch oven is very well made. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cindee4

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived chipped
customer_reviews.text: I ordered cuisinart cast iron Dutch oven because Am Test Kitchen recommended it. Wish I had read the reviews posted first. Many warned of enemal chipping and flaking. Sure enough, mine arrived with big peeling chip on the lip. I love cooking cast iron BUT I need durability. I returned it and will save money to buy le creuset. Again
customer_reviews.author: debra lake

customer_reviews.title: A great Dutch Oven for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I use my Cuisinart Dutch Oven all the time and I couldn’t be happier with it. I have no complaints at all and I strongly recommend this product, it’s a must have in anyone’s kitchen. Things that I use it for - Jambalaya Gumbo Étouffée Roasted/Braised Chicken Pulled Pork/Carnitas Pot Roast Shepard’s Pie Making Stocks (chicken and veggie) Soups But it, use it and you’ll never regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Hardesty

customer_reviews.title: All
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cast iron pan. I wanted one with the enamel lining inside, and the LeCreuset were way to expensive. This was recommended as a great budget substitute. I am using this way more than I expected to. It goes in the dishwasher. This was key: the idea of using just salt to clean a pan did not sit well with me. The only problem with cast iron is that it weighs a ton. I’m glad I stuck with the 10-inch size. I may have to do things in batches (I’m single, so rarely a problem), but the 12-inch might be rather hard to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Angelena

customer_reviews.title: and it has become my favorite, as it has steep sides
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dutch oven to bake my artisan sourdough bread in, and it has become my favorite, as it has steep sides, perfect for one pound loaf, and supports the shape of the loaf very well.
customer_reviews.author: Helander

customer_reviews.title: Classic cast iron still wins
customer_reviews.text: I replaced our Analon anodized aluminum and laminated steel dutch oven with this Cuisinart model based on reviews from America's Test Kitchen. As a true cast iron dutch oven it runs circles around the one I replaced. It was packaged well and arrived in perfect condition. It's handled all of the cooking tasks I've thrown at it like a champ. My only gripe is how much effort it takes to get the light enameled interior to look new when the meal is done.
customer_reviews.author: Doug in CA

customer_reviews.title: A monstrosity of limited use...18 lbs of useless iron.
customer_reviews.text: Inexplicably, the interior enamel surface is textured, unlike the smooth exterior. I assumed that the interior surface would be smooth, like an enameled “Dutch” oven that I have. This rough interior surface means that it’s useless for sautéing, as food adheres to it. I can’t think of an application that it would be more suited for than the Dutch oven pot that I have.
customer_reviews.author: T. McCraw

customer_reviews.title: This is not coated cast iron.
customer_reviews.text: This is the good old cast iron I grew up watching my mother cook on. There is no enamel and no non-stick coating. You will have to keep it seasoned and cannot wash it in the dishwasher. That said, it will be very versatile. You will be able to use it on the stove top, in the oven, over a campfire or grill.
customer_reviews.author: Barb In The Hills

customer_reviews.title: It works very nicely, the color is lovely and it's quite solid
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of cast iron and this is my first skillet with the coating so you don't need to season it. It works very nicely, the color is lovely and it's quite solid. It's easy to clean up and I love not having to worry about the seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Heifenkekfe

customer_reviews.title: Not so sure it is worht paying more compared to Tratomina.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to pay for a Le Crueset model and America's Test Kitchen rated this nearly as high. It is cute and a great size. I did not notice a stark improvement over the Tratomina version I had previously. Perhaps over time it will not chip as easily, but I wish I would have saved the money and went with the Tratomina. Could have gotten this size plus a 5.5 quart together for the price paid for this. I do really like the color and the size.
customer_reviews.author: idateacher2Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: What is it??
customer_reviews.text: Looking for enameled cast iron skillet. No material states whether the black inside is enamel also ?? Much different care and usage on both. cuisinart enameled cast iron is blue exterior and black interior silly I know, but is this cast iron interior that needs seasoning? J
customer_reviews.author: Jessica b.

customer_reviews.title: Best pot for the orice
customer_reviews.text: I love my cast iron enameled pots. Not sure how I cooked w/o one in the past. I can take things from the stovetop to the oven in a single pot. They do get disco Lou red, but nothing that a little soak in bleach for a couple of minutes does not fix. One caution: if you have arthritis or weakness in your hands or arms, this pot is heavy and it gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality... opened up the box and the inside surface was chipped in large chunks... going back immediately
customer_reviews.author: Aarti G Awatramani

customer_reviews.title: Enamel fell off!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and there is a big chunk of enamel falling off! Now I have to waste my time taking this back! What is huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Chung

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged and destroyed! Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! This is how my item arrived. And because the return window closed, this is the best I can do I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Stuck on you
customer_reviews.text: Nothing I could do to this pan prevented food from sticking to it's surface. I've owned cast iron pans my entire life and this is the Worst. Unuseable. After an initial wash I tried it with plenty of olive oil covering the surface. Fried eggs had to be mutilated to slide a spatula under them to turn them over. So I cleaned the pan and seized it ... twice. Same results. Everything sticks to its surface. Possibly Cuisinart used some sort of super glue in its construction? Have had it sitting around to use as a weight on top of grilled cheese that I make easily in another fry pan.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting one of these for a long time. And this is America’s Test Kitchens top recommendation if you’re not getting the French brand. Love the size. Bought the color cuz it was the one on sale but happy with it. It loses a star for the small chip on one of the handles straight out of the box. I’ve used it both stove top and in the oven. It’s just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dutch Oven
customer_reviews.text: Not quite La Creuset but a very good less expensive alternative. Have used for cooking pasta on the stove top and for making artisan bread in the oven. So far everything came out excellent. Clean up has been easy. Quite happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: M Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Excellence and value combined. Must have.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny and your cooking game will instantly be elevated to a level you won’t believe. There is nothing like having the right tools for a job and this baby is a tool that will do many, many jobs for you and last longer than you will. Sorry, but it’s true. I wish I’d purchased one decades ago. There’s no substitute for excel and value and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty skillets but smaller than realized
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to cook steak (sear). They are not easy to clean. I do like the product. Smaller than I thought in size. I wish they were deeper and I wish I bought a bigger size. Heavy to pick up for certain people. Do not use paper towels to wipe dry leaves paper behind. Rough surface. Use lint free towels. You must dry immediately after washing or they will rust.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Performance at one third the price of La Creuset.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, bought to replace a La Creuset of similar size which was damaged after more than 20 years of use. This Cuisinart performed as well at a third of the price. Loving this classic dutch oven.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Neuding

customer_reviews.title: I loved this!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this! It was a gift for my friend. She was so happy when I gave it to her. Her kitchen accents are red and this Cuisinart Cast Iron cookware matched perfectly. Looks great and is very sturdy and well made. I am going to get one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Cebreco

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and versatile Dutch oven
customer_reviews.text: The pan heats up more quickly than my stainless pans and distributes evenly. It can be used for sauces. Searing, pan frying, sourdough loaves, and much more. It does seem to show a little wear or scratching even with using rubber or wooden utensils, but there is no signs of chipping on any of it. Cleans up well with warm water and soap.
customer_reviews.author: melissa boyle

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait to order this?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted a pot like this for a long time, after having this one a few months I wonder why I waited so long! It cooks so evenly and keeps food warm well after I’ve turned off the heat!
customer_reviews.author: Us

customer_reviews.title: Chipped with first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this upon recommendation of America's Test Kitchen. It literally started chipping with the very first use. The edges of the lid chipped, large chunks just fell off. Very disappointed. I suppose they might address it, but seems like a probable hassle to return since I threw away the packaging. And why replace with another inferior product?
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Soup or Stew Pot
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I can find negative is it is very heavy. That being said it is enamel coated cast iron. Positive, this is by the best pot I have ever cooked in and I have just scraped the surface with this Dutch Oven. Nothing so far has attempted to stick to the bottom no matter how long I have let it simmer. I love this dutch oven!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but performs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about this except the weight - but that is why it performs so well so I deal with it by resting it on a heat safe surface while removing food rather than dumping like I do with other light weight pots. Bought it after watching recommendations from Americas Test Kitchen and am glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Babz

customer_reviews.title: Not so good enamel
customer_reviews.text: Came with the enamel destroyed in several spots. Unusable. Packaging however was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Arrin P.

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: The description of the product is unreal. It doesn't grill good. It's very sticky even i spray it or add oil. My meat keep sticking at the bottom. It's not nonstick cast iron. Hard to clean. Very bad product. Please don't buy
customer_reviews.author: sherline

customer_reviews.title: Nice, heavy.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality cast iron. The only thing I dislike is it is difficult to clean in between the ridges. You really have to scrub and it is still difficult to get everything off. Therefore, I don't use it very often. That is just something about which I didn't think.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 5 uses I threw it away. Nearly impossible ...
customer_reviews.text: After 5 uses I threw it away. Nearly impossible to get it clean after use. I bought another with the porcelain on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Hellmuth

customer_reviews.title: Love it, color and all!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. I used it for the first time, Mexican enchilada filling, and it was amazing and it’s the perfect size. These can be quite expensive and I actually got a good deal on this one. Can’t go wrong with Cuisinart, I’ve always been happy with their products.
customer_reviews.author: D. Romig

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with enamel chipped off
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointing - arrived with significant amounts of the enamel already chipped off. Poor quality and poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger enamel cast iron pot and this was just what I was looking for. When I am cooking soup for a crowd this is just what I need. Great on the stove top and perfect in the oven. So happy I ordered it. It is my go to pot and couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl B

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pan and a great value. Bottom scratches easily.
customer_reviews.text: I use it a lot. The bottom got scratched on my gas burners and also scratches when washed. I’m careful and take good care of my pots and pans but it Scratched the surface with a little muscle and a “non-anrasive” pad. Goof off gets grease off really well. I Hand wash with soap and hot water. It cooks great and inside washes easily.
customer_reviews.author: NanaB

customer_reviews.title: Sticky! Extremely hard to clean, I even got ...
customer_reviews.text: Sticky! Extremely hard to clean, I even got a brush just to clean the pan. Is very heavy and it get hot on the handlebars as well.
customer_reviews.author: shirshopper

customer_reviews.title: Good size Dutch oven that cleans up nicely
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this pot and cooking in it so far is easy & it’s reasonably easy to clean. When I unpacked it there was a very small chip on the inside of the cover unfortunately so I’ll have to watch this because enamel tends to get worse. It wasn’t bad enough to return particularly since I needed to use it that night! It came packed with 4 rubber pieces that slip on the sides to keep the cover from chipping during shipping. I keep those on when not using the pit.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Watson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Waaaaay too heavy to us as a cooking essential. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: We love this pan. sear on the stove top and stick it right into a hot oven. great for salmon or any fish. we also make small lamb sausages that work great in this pan.
customer_reviews.author: M Aune

customer_reviews.title: Great little pan!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan! It feels good to break away from Teflon;0) I don't have any idea why anyone would spend a ridiculous amount of $ on Le Creuset unless you are a super chef. This pan cooks evenly and as long as you spray it with olive oil or whatever, things don't stick. (I mean, Teflon for sure works better, but it always ends up scratching after a year even when i'm careful and then I feel like i'm getting cancer;0)) Beware....these suckers are HEAVY though! And the handles do heat up. That's with any cast iron tho. Overall, a great value and a great product! :)
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Great roasting pan.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my husband and one for my 30-something son for Father's Day. The pan must weigh about 20 lbs. I bought for roasting vegetables and rice dishes. Neither has used theirs much, but I love it. The size is big but it still fits in the cabinets. It's an heirloom for the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Saves the day
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have made in a while. Our grill is always having issues so this pan saves the day sometimes! We have an electric stove. Also take it camping. Perfect size. Only thing you don’t get is the grill taste but it’s a fantastic alternative when you don’t have a grill to use. Or even for grilling fruit and veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Dutch oven! I bought it 8 months ago, and used frequently ever since, for cooking, baking and more and it's worked perfectly. Still no chips or any damage that other people are talking about. Given that this Dutch oven was much more affordable than the famous brands, I am super satisfied with this purchase so far. Hopefully it stays that way.
customer_reviews.author: Katarina Vukasinovic

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful dutch oven for two
customer_reviews.text: I have a few recipes that call for a dutch oven, but the full sized one I have is really too big for recipes for two. This smaller one is fantastic and just the right size when I cut down recipes for the two of us.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn E

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: Wife has used it a few times and loves it. It's a good size for bread making. Quality seems good and no chips, but we're careful also.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Cast Iron Pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great affordable enameled cast iron pot, but be aware, this pot weighs 17lbs. empty! My tip: I rub the interior with Grape Seed Oil which can take high temperatures. This really helps with clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: Skyliner

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever cook without this!
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost daily for soups, stews and vegetables. Plus it's great for baking bread in to get a super crust. You can use the lid with high heat in the oven because it's the same material as the pot--not metal or plastic. Cleans easily. I also have the larger size of this pot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chip at first used... don’t let the brand miss lead you
customer_reviews.text: Chip at first use! What a big disappointment. I could not return it because I used long after I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Pazmino

customer_reviews.title: Everything sticks to it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the enameled cast iron 10" fry pan and I am extremely disappointed with it. *Everything* sticks to it. Spend a little more and invest in something that will do the job and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: My mom loves it. Great addition however this product is really hard to maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: The only pot I need
customer_reviews.text: This is a versatile pot - into the oven, on the burners, I can cook anything. It's big enough but not too deep, with a heavy bottom that really distributes heat. The cream colored interior makes it easy to judge how the cooking is coming, and makes it easy to see when it's clean. Kind of heavy; I am careful when I wash it. It was a good price - I have wanted one for a long time but it didn't cost as much as I had feared.
customer_reviews.author: kathi brady

customer_reviews.title: Enamel Chips
customer_reviews.text: I really like Cuisinart products. So far the quality has been fantastic - until now. After 1 month with the product the enamel chipped and exposed the cast iron on the base of the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dutch oven
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use for making our sour dough bread but it's been great for pulled port and roasts. It's very heavy and the lid fits on well. The clean up on this is so easy and the red looks great on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C. Pillon

customer_reviews.title: Get a Lodge
customer_reviews.text: For a variety of reasons I needed a cast iron that was a different color. After reading a lot of reviews I opted for this one and have been using it for 1.5 years. It is very average. It cooks fine but it does not clean easily. If you are debating on this vs. a standard Lodge Cast Iron I would strongly recommend a Lodge over this.
customer_reviews.author: Eytan Seidman

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, great heat distribution and retention, super easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: As you can imagine, this is heavy but not overly so. The enamel holds up well to normal cooking and is super easy to clean, no heavy scrubbing required after cooking up a chowder. The heat distribution is perfect and the heat retention is excellent. Just what I need for stove top and stove to oven dishes.
customer_reviews.author: The Supply Guy

customer_reviews.title: A good investment
customer_reviews.text: The most expensive piece of cookware I ever bought but I love it. I use it a lot for browning meat and I like that it can go from stove top to oven. It cleans easily. I store it on top of the stove because it's a good looking pot and also because it's a heavy pot!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Marie

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this dutch oven. My favorite part is the very flat and squared off bottom edge (opposed to a rounded one) so I get the maximum surface area to brown. Very even distribution of heat and has tackled every task I've thrown at it thus far. Looks beautiful sitting on my shelf too.
customer_reviews.author: TeaTega03

customer_reviews.title: No what expected.
customer_reviews.text: Item description was misleading as it was listed with the ceramic coated pans. When you click on the 12 inch pan it automatically takes you to the non coated cast iron which is not what I intended to order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We loved this but just noticed a slight crack in bottom
customer_reviews.text: We loved this but just noticed a slight crack in bottom. Not happy with this. We probably have used it four times. What can we do? Seems like for the money it should have lasted longer. Thank you,Diane
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: To shallow to use
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. It’s too shallow to hold even a steak. Do not waste time, money or effort. I returned immediately and purchased the Lodge grill pan instead.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken/chipped, could not use. Returned it
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to accurately review the cooking quality of the item. The item came damaged with multiple places where the enamel was chipped or broken off. I returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C

customer_reviews.title: The lid is great for keeping things warmer longer and this should be ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the smaller 10" enamel pan from cuisinart that I use for very important dishes but it wasn't big enough. This is big enough for my thanksgiving stuffing or a real cornbread without actually being too big. The lid is great for keeping things warmer longer and this should be a must have for any home kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Tony Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: a quality made product
customer_reviews.text: there are no dislikes. I like the looks and finish of the pot and lid. It cooks like a dream and cleans up easily. There is nothing more I could ask from this pot. My only regret, not purchasing it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: James J Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Down!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first cast iron pot that I have ever had that rusts so easily and very hard to season! Not to mention the food continues to stick to the pan. Not happy with this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Perry

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Heat distribution is very good. Cleaning is easy. My only complaint is a small defect on the inner side of the lid, there is a small hole where there is no enamel. Overall, I am pleased with this dutch oven.
customer_reviews.author: Ovadu

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase !
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for an oval dutch oven. I ran across this one and I really like it. I ordered it in red, always order blue it seems. A very nice oval dutch oven.
customer_reviews.author: Elliemae

customer_reviews.title: extremely well made and good looking enough for company
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Very versatile size and shape, extremely well made and good looking enough for company. Large enough for a big chicken or giant roast beef, and I have also used it for big casseroles. The lid fits just right. It's very heavy, which I consider a plus as it cooks very evenly. The inside surface is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Emma's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love the color but it does chip a little around ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the color but it does chip a little around the top edges if your not careful. Clean up is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisenart rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. A bit heavy though I feel bad for the delivery person because of the weight. Heats and cooks evenly. A great find.
customer_reviews.author: Ferret  Lady

customer_reviews.title: It isn't non-stick
customer_reviews.text: Even after seasoning with oil, the non-stick surface failed to keep foods from sticking. Used it a few times then it went straight into into the trash. Could have been a knock-off. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Cox

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: Cooks nice and even. Usually cleans easily especially if cooking spray is utilized. Too heavy for my wife to move so I assist. Place on large cookie sheet in the oven to distribute weight over larger area on the oven rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron and Enamel? YES!
customer_reviews.text: This and it's mate are my two new favourite pans. Look nice, cook well, clean easy, and best of all... cooks food evenly without bowing from heat like other pans.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful purchase,  very happy
customer_reviews.text: Really wonderful castiron! I am beyond thrilled with this. I wish it came in more colors, but the red is pretty. Wonderful heat distribution. Super heavy and best of all, dishwasher safe!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Princeton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pan!!
customer_reviews.text: This is solid and heeeeeeaaaaaaavyyyyyy!!! But MAN is it good! It's essentially an iron pan coated in ceramic. The heat disperses through it very evenly and the dishes i cook in it come out amazing! Nothing else to say here.
customer_reviews.author: This Guy

customer_reviews.title: Chipping enamel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. The enamel is already coming off in two spots in less than a month. The has been hand washed and never banged around.
customer_reviews.author: MarineVet
